alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 14 at 9:42PM MST until February 15 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with north wind gusting 35 to 50 mph over northeast Johnson County. Total snowfall 2 to 4 inches with north wind gusting 25 to 35 mph over central and southeast Johnson County. * WHERE...Northeast Johnson County and Southeast Johnson County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday, although much of the snow will have ended by shortly after midnight Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially along I-90. The hazardous road conditions will impact the Wednesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Localized white-out conditions along I- 90, especially from Buffalo to the Sheridan County line.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
